title: Restaurant Pavilion / Sahabat Selojene
description: In the heart of Salatiga, Selojene has designed Nusa Kitchen, a semi-open pavilion showcasing a bold reinterpretation of traditional terracotta tiles. Typically used as roofing material in tropical climates with high humidity, these tiles have been creatively repurposed as a building facade, enclosing the entire ground floor of the dining area. Spanning 1100m¬≤ over 2 floors, it is part of Bumi Kayom, a pioneering contemporary F&B complex in Salatiga. The building's bold appearance accommodates a fusion of Eastern and Western culinary traditions, offering an alternative dining atmosphere in this town of 200.000 people.
author: Miwa Negoro

title: Ankh House / TAU Arquitetos + Studio Zanskar
description: A Living House Inspired by the meaning of the Egyptian term per ankh, which can be translated as ‚Äúhouse of life,‚Äù Casa Ankh aims to establish a coextension between body, environment, and everyday life. Located on a rural plot in the countryside of S√£o Paulo, the house was conceived as a sensitive response to the surrounding natural context. Set on an extensive site with a pronounced slope, the residence engages in dialogue with the uneven topography and celebrates the mountainous landscape in the background, incorporating the presence of nature as a fundamental element of its architectural composition.
